DOC.brief_summary: A diet-controlled clinical trial attempt provide estimate effect black tea consumption serum lipid tightly control condition , include control diet . Mildly hypercholesterolemic individual ( total cholesterol level 4.9 6.7 mmol/L , 190 260 mg/dl ) , non-smoking , chronic disease-free individual enrol 15-week , double blind , randomize crossover trial , consume control low-flavonoid diet plus 5 cup black tea tea-like placebo two 4-week treatment period .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Black Tea Intake Serum Lipids
DOC.criteria: 4565 year old mildly hypercholesterolemic ( total cholesterol level 4.9 6.7 mmol/L , 190 260 mg/dl ) highdensity lipoprotein cholesterol ( HDLC ) 0.9 1.6 mmol/L ( 35 65 mg/dl ) triglyceride ( TG ) concentration 6.8 mmol/L ( 600 mg/dl ) habitually consume typical American diet low dietary flavonoid intake ( < 4 onehalf cup serving fruit vegetables/day ) low intake ( < 1 serving/day ) soyrich food , nut , herb , spice ( besides salt pepper ) aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) 0 55 mg/L creatinine 70.7 150.3 mmol/L ( 0.8 1.7 mg/dl ) glucose 3.3 6.4 mmol/L ( 60 115 mg/dl ) current smoker usage high amount antioxidant vitamin supplement ( > 3 time Recommended Dietary Allowance ( RDA ) vitamins E , C , selenium , > 10 mg/day beta carotene ) diagnose diabetes , coagulation disorder , chronic pulmonary disease , current active malignancy , renal disease require dialysis , malabsorption , gastrointestinal disorder , history cardiovascular disease . antihypertensive , immunosuppressive , cholesterol lowering , anticoagulant medication consume > 3 serving alcohol daily Premenopausal ( woman )
